intro: Colubrina travancorica, commonly known as Travancore colubrina, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody shrub form with opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by capsule fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
